creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: three full lines of cursive calligraphy, shorter line at L; mounted on blue fabric
inscription: 两个黄鹂鸣翠柳，一行白鹭上青天。 窗含西岭千秋雪，门泊东吴万里船。(Two orioles sing in the blue-green willows, / White herons in a line ascend the blue sky; / My window frames West Mountain snow of a thousand ages, / Moored before my gate are boats that will travel ten thousand miles in the east. (SA))
markings: UR: 雨笠煙霧; LLQ: 阮瑜之印; LLQ2: 一片氷心在玉壺; sticker back L side when rolled, in pencil: [75.7.11/ Addiss]
signed: LL edge: 祇園瑜書（Wrote by Gion Yu)
title: Poem by Du Fu in Cursive Script
